title: Performance Comparison of Quantum Simulation Packages: Julia vs. Python
text:
Here we compare the performance of QuantumToolbox.jl with other quantum simulation packages: - QuTiP (Python) - dynamiqs (Python - JAX) - QuantumOptics.jl (Julia)
To allow reproducibility, this page is generated with Quarto based on this repository. Moreover, to keep the code clean, we use the PythonCall.jl package to call Python code from Julia. We tested that the overhead of calling Python code from Julia is negligible for the purpose of this benchmark.



import QuantumToolbox
import QuantumOptics
using CairoMakie
using PythonCall
using BenchmarkTools

np = pyimport("numpy")
qutip = pyimport("qutip")
jax = pyimport("jax")
jnp = jax.numpy
dynamiqs = pyimport("dynamiqs")

dynamiqs.set_device("cpu")

Python: None





Parameters:

N = 50
Δ = 0.1
F = 2
γ = 1
nth = 0.8

0.8





a = QuantumToolbox.destroy(N)
H = Δ * a' * a + F * (a + a')
c_ops = [sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, sqrt(γ * nth) * a']

tlist = range(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = QuantumToolbox.fock(N, 0)

QuantumToolbox.mesolve(H, ψ0, tlist, c_ops, progress_bar = Val(false)).states[2] # Warm-up

mesolve_quantumtoolbox = @benchmark QuantumToolbox.mesolve($H, $ψ0, $tlist, $c_ops, progress_bar = Val(false)).states[2]

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 100 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  49.062 ms … 56.877 ms  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 10.65%
 Time  (median):     49.938 ms              ┊ GC (median):    0.70%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   50.197 ms ±  1.150 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  0.73% ±  1.58%

     ▃▄ █ ▆▂                                                   
  ▅▆▆███████▅▃▅▃▄▅▄▆▅▁▁▃▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▅▁▁▁▁▁▃▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▃ ▃
  49.1 ms         Histogram: frequency by time        55.6 ms <

 Memory estimate: 7.42 MiB, allocs estimate: 802.






a = qutip.destroy(N)
H = Δ * a.dag() * a + F * (a + a.dag())
c_ops = pylist([np.sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, np.sqrt(γ * nth) * a.dag()])

tlist = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = qutip.fock(N, 0)

qutip.mesolve(H, ψ0, tlist, c_ops).states[1] # Warm-up

mesolve_qutip = @benchmark qutip.mesolve($H, $ψ0, $tlist, $c_ops).states[1]

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 22 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  231.322 ms … 234.656 ms  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 0.00%
 Time  (median):     232.209 ms               ┊ GC (median):    0.00%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   232.411 ms ± 817.598 μs  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  0.00% ± 0.00%

                  █                                              
  ▅▁▁▁▅▁▁▁▅▅▅▁▅██▁█▁▅▅▁▁▁▅▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁█▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▅▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▅ ▁
  231 ms           Histogram: frequency by time          235 ms <

 Memory estimate: 464 bytes, allocs estimate: 20.






a = dynamiqs.destroy(N)
H = Δ * jnp.matmul(dynamiqs.dag(a), a) + F * (a + dynamiqs.dag(a))
c_ops = [jnp.sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, jnp.sqrt(γ * nth) * dynamiqs.dag(a)]

tlist = jnp.linspace(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = dynamiqs.fock(N, 0)

dynamiqs.mesolve(H, c_ops, ψ0, tlist, options = dynamiqs.Options(progress_meter = nothing)).states # Warm-up

mesolve_dynamiqs =
    @benchmark dynamiqs.mesolve($H, $c_ops, $ψ0, $tlist, options = dynamiqs.Options(progress_meter = nothing)).states

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 14 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  147.044 ms … 395.866 ms  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 0.00%
 Time  (median):     374.404 ms               ┊ GC (median):    0.00%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   360.778 ms ±  61.818 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  0.00% ± 0.00%

                                                         █       
  ▄▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁█▆█▁▁▄ ▁
  147 ms           Histogram: frequency by time          396 ms <

 Memory estimate: 1.45 KiB, allocs estimate: 66.






bas = QuantumOptics.FockBasis(N)
a = QuantumOptics.destroy(bas)

H = Δ * a' * a + F * (a + a')
c_ops = [sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, sqrt(γ * nth) * a']

tlist = range(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = QuantumOptics.fockstate(bas, 0)

QuantumOptics.timeevolution.master(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops)[2][2]

mesolve_quantumoptics = @benchmark QuantumOptics.timeevolution.master($tlist, $ψ0, $H, $c_ops)

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 56 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  88.843 ms … 94.895 ms  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 0.00%
 Time  (median):     90.600 ms              ┊ GC (median):    0.00%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   90.737 ms ±  1.185 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  0.14% ± 0.43%

             ▃  ▁▃    █        ▁                               
  ▇▄▄▁▁▁▄▄▄▁▄█▇▇██▇▁▇▇█▄▄▇▄▁▁▁▇█▁▁▇▄▁▁▄▄▇▁▁▁▁▁▇▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▄ ▁
  88.8 ms         Histogram: frequency by time        94.1 ms <

 Memory estimate: 4.78 MiB, allocs estimate: 643.






Parameters:

N = 50
Δ = 0.1
F = 2
γ = 1
nth = 0.8
ntraj = 100

100





a = QuantumToolbox.destroy(N)
H = Δ * a' * a + F * (a + a')
c_ops = [sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, sqrt(γ * nth) * a']

tlist = range(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = QuantumToolbox.fock(N, 0)

QuantumToolbox.mcsolve(H, ψ0, tlist, c_ops, progress_bar = Val(false), ntraj = ntraj).states[2] # Warm-up

mcsolve_quantumtoolbox =
    @benchmark QuantumToolbox.mcsolve($H, $ψ0, $tlist, $c_ops, progress_bar = Val(false), ntraj = ntraj).states[2]

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 99 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  42.134 ms … 68.669 ms  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 21.15%
 Time  (median):     49.778 ms              ┊ GC (median):    0.00%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   50.598 ms ±  4.803 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  2.36% ±  3.43%

             ▂   ▄  ▄█  █      ▄                               
  ▄▁▁▄▁█▆▄▆▆████▆█▄▆██▄▆███▁█▄▆█▄█▁█▄▁▆▁▆█▁▁▆▁▁▁▄▁▆▄▁▁▁▄▁▁▄▁▄ ▁
  42.1 ms         Histogram: frequency by time        63.2 ms <

 Memory estimate: 13.85 MiB, allocs estimate: 45353.






a = qutip.destroy(N)
H = Δ * a.dag() * a + F * (a + a.dag())
c_ops = pylist([np.sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, np.sqrt(γ * nth) * a.dag()])

tlist = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = qutip.fock(N, 0)

qutip.mcsolve(
    H,
    ψ0,
    tlist,
    c_ops,
    ntraj = ntraj,
    options = pydict(Dict("progress_bar" => false, "map" => "parallel", "num_cpus" => Threads.nthreads())),
).states[1] # Warm-up

mcsolve_qutip = @benchmark qutip.mcsolve(
    $H,
    $ψ0,
    $tlist,
    $c_ops,
    ntraj = ntraj,
    options = pydict(Dict("progress_bar" => false, "map" => "parallel", "num_cpus" => Threads.nthreads())),
).states[1]

/home/alberto/anaconda3/lib/python3.11/multiprocessing/popen_fork.py:66: RuntimeWarning: os.fork() was called. os.fork() is incompatible with multithreaded code, and JAX is multithreaded, so this will likely lead to a deadlock.
  self.pid = os.fork()


BenchmarkTools.Trial: 5 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  1.089 s …   1.141 s  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 0.00%
 Time  (median):     1.101 s              ┊ GC (median):    0.00%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   1.108 s ± 19.808 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  0.00% ± 0.00%

  █          █ █       █                                  █  
  █▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁█▁█▁▁▁▁▁▁▁█▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁█ ▁
  1.09 s         Histogram: frequency by time        1.14 s <

 Memory estimate: 1.95 KiB, allocs estimate: 51.









bas = QuantumOptics.FockBasis(N)
a = QuantumOptics.destroy(bas)

H = Δ * a' * a + F * (a + a')
c_ops = [sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, sqrt(γ * nth) * a']

tlist = range(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = QuantumOptics.fockstate(bas, 0)

function quantumoptics_mcwf(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops, ntraj)
    Threads.@threads for i in 1:ntraj
        QuantumOptics.timeevolution.mcwf(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops, display_beforeevent = true, display_afterevent = true)[2][2]
    end
end

quantumoptics_mcwf(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops, ntraj) # Warm-up

mesolve_quantumoptics = @benchmark quantumoptics_mcwf($tlist, $ψ0, $H, $c_ops, ntraj)

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 79 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  49.682 ms … 71.091 ms  ┊ GC (min … max):  0.00% … 15.00%
 Time  (median):     63.459 ms              ┊ GC (median):    10.37%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   63.436 ms ±  4.001 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  10.92% ±  3.45%

                           ▂  ▂▅▅    █ ▂ █▂    ▂▅▂▂            
  ▅▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▁▅▁█▅▁▅▅█▁████▅▅███▅██████▅▁████▅▁█▅▅▅▅▅██ ▁
  49.7 ms         Histogram: frequency by time        70.7 ms <

 Memory estimate: 75.29 MiB, allocs estimate: 234743.







mesolve_times = [
    1e-6 * sum(m.times) / length(m.times) for
    m in [mesolve_quantumtoolbox, mesolve_qutip, mesolve_dynamiqs, mesolve_quantumoptics]
]
mcsolve_times =
    [1e-6 * sum(m.times) / length(m.times) for m in [mcsolve_quantumtoolbox, mcsolve_qutip, mesolve_quantumoptics]]

#

fig = Figure(size = (500, 300))
ax = Axis(
    fig[1, 1],
    xticks = (1:2, ["mesolve", "mcsolve"]),
    ylabel = "Time (ms)",
    title = "Performance Comparison with Other Packages",
)

colors = Makie.wong_colors()

barplot!(
    ax,
    ones(length(mesolve_times)),
    mesolve_times,
    dodge = 1:length(mesolve_times),
    color = colors[1:length(mesolve_times)],
)

barplot!(ax, 2 * ones(length(mcsolve_times)), mcsolve_times, dodge = 1:length(mcsolve_times), color = colors[[1, 2, 4]])

ylims!(ax, 0, nothing)

# Legend

labels = ["QuantumToolbox.jl", "QuTiP", "dynamiqs", "QuantumOptics.jl"]
elements = [PolyElement(polycolor = colors[i]) for i in 1:length(labels)]

axislegend(ax, elements, labels, position = :lt)

save("package_comparison.png", fig);

fig

title: Performance Comparison of Quantum Simulation Packages: Julia vs. Python
text:
import QuantumToolbox
import QuantumOptics
using CairoMakie
using PythonCall
using BenchmarkTools

np = pyimport("numpy")
qutip = pyimport("qutip")
jax = pyimport("jax")
jnp = jax.numpy
dynamiqs = pyimport("dynamiqs")

dynamiqs.set_device("cpu")

Python: None

title: Performance Comparison of Quantum Simulation Packages: Julia vs. Python
text:
Parameters:

N = 50
Δ = 0.1
F = 2
γ = 1
nth = 0.8
ntraj = 100

100





a = QuantumToolbox.destroy(N)
H = Δ * a' * a + F * (a + a')
c_ops = [sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, sqrt(γ * nth) * a']

tlist = range(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = QuantumToolbox.fock(N, 0)

QuantumToolbox.mcsolve(H, ψ0, tlist, c_ops, progress_bar = Val(false), ntraj = ntraj).states[2] # Warm-up

mcsolve_quantumtoolbox =
    @benchmark QuantumToolbox.mcsolve($H, $ψ0, $tlist, $c_ops, progress_bar = Val(false), ntraj = ntraj).states[2]

BenchmarkTools.Trial: 99 samples with 1 evaluation.
 Range (min … max):  42.134 ms … 68.669 ms  ┊ GC (min … max): 0.00% … 21.15%
 Time  (median):     49.778 ms              ┊ GC (median):    0.00%
 Time  (mean ± σ):   50.598 ms ±  4.803 ms  ┊ GC (mean ± σ):  2.36% ±  3.43%

a = qutip.destroy(N)
H = Δ * a.dag() * a + F * (a + a.dag())
c_ops = pylist([np.sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, np.sqrt(γ * nth) * a.dag()])

tlist = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = qutip.fock(N, 0)

qutip.mcsolve(
    H,
    ψ0,
    tlist,
    c_ops,
    ntraj = ntraj,
    options = pydict(Dict("progress_bar" => false, "map" => "parallel", "num_cpus" => Threads.nthreads())),
).states[1] # Warm-up

mcsolve_qutip = @benchmark qutip.mcsolve(
    $H,
    $ψ0,
    $tlist,
    $c_ops,
    ntraj = ntraj,
    options = pydict(Dict("progress_bar" => false, "map" => "parallel", "num_cpus" => Threads.nthreads())),
).states[1]

bas = QuantumOptics.FockBasis(N)
a = QuantumOptics.destroy(bas)

H = Δ * a' * a + F * (a + a')
c_ops = [sqrt(γ * (1 + nth)) * a, sqrt(γ * nth) * a']

tlist = range(0, 10, 100)
ψ0 = QuantumOptics.fockstate(bas, 0)

function quantumoptics_mcwf(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops, ntraj)
    Threads.@threads for i in 1:ntraj
        QuantumOptics.timeevolution.mcwf(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops, display_beforeevent = true, display_afterevent = true)[2][2]
    end
end

quantumoptics_mcwf(tlist, ψ0, H, c_ops, ntraj) # Warm-up

mesolve_quantumoptics = @benchmark quantumoptics_mcwf($tlist, $ψ0, $H, $c_ops, ntraj)

title: Performance Comparison of Quantum Simulation Packages: Julia vs. Python
text:
mesolve_times = [
    1e-6 * sum(m.times) / length(m.times) for
    m in [mesolve_quantumtoolbox, mesolve_qutip, mesolve_dynamiqs, mesolve_quantumoptics]
]
mcsolve_times =
    [1e-6 * sum(m.times) / length(m.times) for m in [mcsolve_quantumtoolbox, mcsolve_qutip, mesolve_quantumoptics]]

#

fig = Figure(size = (500, 300))
ax = Axis(
    fig[1, 1],
    xticks = (1:2, ["mesolve", "mcsolve"]),
    ylabel = "Time (ms)",
    title = "Performance Comparison with Other Packages",
)

colors = Makie.wong_colors()

barplot!(
    ax,
    ones(length(mesolve_times)),
    mesolve_times,
    dodge = 1:length(mesolve_times),
    color = colors[1:length(mesolve_times)],
)

barplot!(ax, 2 * ones(length(mcsolve_times)), mcsolve_times, dodge = 1:length(mcsolve_times), color = colors[[1, 2, 4]])

ylims!(ax, 0, nothing)

# Legend

labels = ["QuantumToolbox.jl", "QuTiP", "dynamiqs", "QuantumOptics.jl"]
elements = [PolyElement(polycolor = colors[i]) for i in 1:length(labels)]

axislegend(ax, elements, labels, position = :lt)

save("package_comparison.png", fig);

fig

title: Performance Comparison of Quantum Simulation Packages: Julia vs. Python
